headline.main: BELGRADE IS FIRM; Goes On Preparing for War While Denying German Charges ACTION IS EXPECTED SOON Serb-Croat Unity Is Gaining as Nazi Troops Mass on the Yugoslav Frontier ROME PLEA FAILING IN YUGOSLAV CRISIS

lead_paragraph: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, April 1 -- An eleventh-hour attempt by Italy to halt Germany's apparent headlong plunge into war with Yugoslavia through mediation by Premier Mussolini in Rome appeared doomed at the outset tonight by Germany's intensified hostility and the reported statement of a German Legation spokesman that "the situation is hopeless."
abstract: Yugoslavs firm in anti-Axis policy; deny German charges; Rome favors German-Yugoslav compromise

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
